title: Tasks API broken — 500 errors across all task endpoints
body:
Since the latest deploy, basically every endpoint under /api/v1/tasks/ is returning 500 errors. Listing tasks, getting a single task, creating tasks — all broken.

I checked the users and organizations endpoints and those seem fine, so it's specific to tasks.

This is blocking the frontend team, please prioritize.

title: Cannot create new tasks — something about invalid timestamp
body:
When trying to create a new task via POST /api/v1/tasks/, the API returns a 500. I looked at the logs briefly and saw something about a timestamp format issue but couldn't figure out where it's coming from.

This might be related to issue #1 but I'm not sure — the error message looks different.

title: Comments feature completely down
body: The comments endpoint (/api/v1/comments/) is returning 500s. Users can't view or add comments on any task. The error seems database-related but I haven't dug into it yet.

title: Permission checks failing on write operations
body:
Users with proper write permissions are getting rejected when trying to update or delete tasks. The error is coming from somewhere in the auth middleware.

I think this started after the last refactor but not 100% sure.

title: Deploy investigation: database migrations not applied to Postgres
body:
Following up on the 500 errors in #1 and #3 — I connected directly to Postgres and the schema looks incomplete. The later migrations (priority column, due_date, comments table) are all present as files in alembic/versions/ but they were never actually applied to the Postgres database.

I ran `alembic current` inside the container and it returns nothing — as if alembic has never touched this database. But the migration files themselves are definitely correct, I read through all of them.

My hunch is alembic is falling back to the SQLite URL in alembic.ini instead of connecting to Postgres. I think the env var refactoring from last sprint may have broken something in how the migration config picks up the database connection string.

Low priority compared to the other P0/P1s, but this should be fixed too so deploys work correctly.
